name: Olivia Bennett
focus: Gourmet tastings & wildlife encounters across Bruny Island
specialties: White wallaby spotting at Adventure Bay
certifications: St John Remote Area First Aid
bio: Olivia grew up on Tasmania's south-east coast and knows every curve of the D'Entrecasteaux Channel. She curates relaxed but detailed days that balance coastal walks, gourmet tastings, and wildlife moments.
approach: She keeps itineraries flexible, adding spontaneous tasting stops or scenic detours whenever guests show interest. Her goal is to make every Bruny Island visit feel like a local friend is hosting you.
highlight: When guests spot dolphins from the ferry or climb The Neck for sunset, Olivia is the first to cheer and grab the best photo angle.

name: Ethan MacGregor
focus: Summit sunrises, alpine walks & Richmond heritage stories
specialties: Historic walking tours through Richmond Village
bio: Ethan is a former outdoor education teacher who now spends his days sharing kunanyi/Mount Wellington. Guests love his ability to explain geology, weather patterns, and convict-era tales in a warm, engaging way.
approach: He monitors conditions in real time, ensuring every summit visit feels effortless and safe. On the way down he weaves in Richmond's colonial history and the best bakery recommendations.
highlight: Ethan always brings a thermos of locally roasted coffee for chilly summit mornings—one sip while overlooking Hobart makes the early start worth it.

name: Sienna Clarke
focus: Tailor-made one-day charters across Bruny Island & Hobart
bio: Sienna listens closely to every group before they travel, then crafts a schedule that feels effortless yet rich in detail. She knows every producer on Bruny Island by name and reserves tables before the crowds arrive.
approach: Her van is stocked with picnic blankets, phone chargers, child seats, and locally sourced snacks so guests can simply relax.
highlight: Sienna’s favourite moment is when private charter guests realise they managed to see wildlife, taste gourmet treats, and still be back in Hobart stress-free.

name: Noah Williams
focus: Bruny Island coastlines, Neck Lookout walks & ferry hosting
specialties: Guided walks at The Neck & Adventure Bay
Providing accessible options for all guests
bio: Noah grew up fishing with his grandfather around the Channel, so he reads the water like a book. Guests count on him to spot wedge-tailed eagles before anyone else notices.
approach: He keeps binoculars at the ready and shares gentle guidance so everyone can photograph wildlife respectfully.
highlight: Hearing guests gasp when penguins surface near the ferry never gets old for Noah.

name: Harper Nguyen
focus: Richmond Village, Hobart heritage lanes & foodie stops
specialties: Guided tastings in Hobart’s Salamanca precinct
bio: Harper combines history with genuine local tips. Travellers say her calm style makes them feel instantly at home in Tasmania.
approach: She carries archival photos to bring stories to life and always adds time for guests to sample pastries or artisan chocolate.
highlight: Watching guests walk the Richmond Bridge after hearing its convict stories is Harper’s proudest guiding moment.

name: Luca Fernandez
specialties: Ensuring accessible boarding on ferries and vehicles
Supporting adventure add-ons like short hikes
bio: Luca is the calm presence behind our smooth operations. He coordinates pickup windows, communicates with local producers, and keeps guests comfortable between stops.
approach: He double-checks every detail—from chilled bottled water to spare jackets—so travellers can simply focus on the view.
highlight: Guests often mention Luca’s playlists and gentle humour as the soundtrack to their Tasmanian memories.
